content: going to be alternating row so your row stay even you are going to be working just on the top of the hexagon shape now building up row 14 - ch3 double_crochet in the first space *if you are right handed like i am you will be working in the right corner space* then continue with 3dc clusters until the last stitch & make 2dc ch1 & fo ©ashleymaglich ©ashleymaglich row 15 - you re going to ch3 in between the 2dc from last round then start your 3dc clusters in the next space until you reach the 2dc then 1dc in between them ch1 & fo these are the row you will alternate until you reach your 8 row or your desired length *it s important to note try & have somewhat of a loose gauge if that s hard for you to do then i would recommend you size up a hook size for this part ©ashleymaglich ©ashleymaglich once you reach your 8rows or desired length you are now going to stitch your stocking closed fold the hexagon in an l shape to where the right sides are together *what i mean by this is the sides where your ends are not hanging out you can usually tell which side is the right & wrong sides ©ashleymaglich note i like how the stocking looks both ways with the single_crochet stitching inside & outside it s just a personal preference if you want to see what the single_crochet stitching looks like scroll down in the pattern so you can certainly keep your stocking where the right sides are showing & do your single_crochet where they show vs having them on the inside of the stocking & having to flip it inside out afterall this pattern is simply a guide let your imagination & creativity take you where it may at this point if you have any loose ends this is where you are going to want to sew them in ©ashleymaglich insert your hook into the first stitch at the top of the stocking *through both sides of the stocking* pull your yarn through ch1 & single_crochet back into that same stitch ©ashleymaglich note just do your best to judge where to put the stitches for the first 8 row because you are going to be making stitches into the sides of the double_crochet stitches that you made so there isn t technically a stitch to go into until after the 8 row ©ashleymaglich you are going to make a single_crochet in every stitch around starting from the top of the stocking down to where the heel starts ©ashleymaglich in the last stitch down you are going to make 4 single_crochet in that same stitch this is to give the heel some curve to it you will now continue to make a single_crochet in each stitch down on the last single_crochet ch1 & fo ©ashleymaglich *the
